intro: Prestoea pubens var. semispicata, commonly known as the white hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It is characterized by its large, showy white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. It thrives in warm, humid climates and requires well-drained soil. The species is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other hibiscus and cotton plants.
